results.question: List all employees in the Sales department
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id WHERE d.name = 'Sales' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many employees were hired in 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees WHERE EXTRACT(YEAR FROM hire_date) = 2024;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: What is the average salary by department?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, AVG(e.salary) AS avg_salary FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.department_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all customers with credit limit over $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.* FROM customers c WHERE c.credit_limit > 100000;

results.question: How many sales orders are in pending status?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT * FROM sales_orders WHERE status = 'pending') AS pending_sales_orders LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all products in the Electronics category
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM products AS p JOIN product_categories AS pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id WHERE pc.name = 'Electronics' AND p.is_active LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the names of all warehouses?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT w.name FROM warehouses w LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all active vendors
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.* FROM vendors v WHERE v.is_active = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different account types in the chart of accounts?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT a.name FROM account_types a JOIN chart_of_accounts c ON a.type_id = c.account_type_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all bank accounts and their current balances
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number, b.bank_name, b.current_balance FROM bank_accounts b LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many projects are currently active?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM projects WHERE status = 'active' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.* FROM fixed_assets AS fa LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are all the available leave types?
results.sql_generated: SELECT lt.name FROM leave_types AS lt LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all training courses that are mandatory
results.sql_generated: SELECT tc.name AS course_name, tc.duration_hours, tc.cost FROM employee_training et JOIN training_courses tc ON et.course_id = tc.course_id WHERE tc.is_mandatory = TRUE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different opportunity stages?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT stage_id FROM sales_opportunities LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all countries in the system
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.name FROM countries AS c LIMIT 1000;

results.question: How many departments are there?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM departments LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all units of measure
results.sql_generated: SELECT uom.* FROM units_of_measure AS uom LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What fiscal years exist in the system?
results.sql_generated: SELECT fy.year FROM fiscal_years AS fy LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What are the different asset categories?
results.sql_generated: SELECT DISTINCT ac.category_id, ac.name FROM asset_categories ac LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees who have been with the company for more than 5 years and earn above $100,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id WHERE e.hire_date <= (CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '5 years') AND s.amount > 100000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List employees and their managers' names
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name || ' ' || e.last_name AS employee_name, m.first_name || ' ' || m.last_name AS manager_name FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employees m ON e.manager_id = m.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which employees have pending leave requests?
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name AS first_name, lr.leave_type_id AS leave_type_id, lt.is_paid AS is_paid FROM employees e JOIN leave_requests lr ON e.employee_id = lr.employee_id LEFT JOIN leave_types lt ON lt.name = lt.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the number of employees per position title
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.title AS PositionTitle, COUNT(e.employee_id) AS NumEmployees FROM positions p JOIN employees e ON p.position_id = e.position_id GROUP BY p.title LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find employees with expiring certifications in the next 6 months
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employee_certifications ec JOIN employees e ON ec.employee_id = e.employee_id WHERE ec.expiry_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '6 month') GROUP BY e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total sales amount by customer for 2024?
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.customer_id AS customer_id, SUM(sales_orders.total) AS total_sales FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders ON c.customer_id = sales_orders.customer_id WHERE YEAR(sales_orders.order_date) = 2024 GROUP BY c.customer_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: function year(date) does not exist

results.question: List the top 10 customers by total order value
results.error_message: Model did not generate SELECT statement

results.question: Show sales opportunities in the Negotiation stage worth over $50,000
results.sql_generated: SELECT so.* FROM sales_opportunities so JOIN opportunity_stages os ON so.stage_id = os.stage_id WHERE os.name = 'Negotiation' AND so.amount > 50000 LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the conversion rate from quotes to orders?
results.sql_generated: SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT quote_id) AS total_quotes, COUNT(order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders JOIN order_lines ON sales_orders.order_id = order_lines.order_id JOIN quote_lines ON order_lines.line_id = quote_lines.line_id WHERE sales_orders.status = 'Completed' AND quote_lines.discount_percent > 0 LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column reference "quote_id" is ambiguous

results.question: List sales orders by sales representative with their totals
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.sales_rep_id AS rep_id, COUNT(s.order_id) AS total_orders FROM sales_orders s GROUP BY s.sales_rep_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Which products have inventory below their reorder point?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name FROM products p INNER JOIN reorder_rules r ON p.product_id = r.product_id INNER JOIN inventory_levels i ON p.product_id = i.product_id WHERE i.quantity_available < r.min_quantity LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show total inventory value by warehouse
results.sql_generated: SELECT wh.name AS WarehouseName, SUM(il.quantity_on_hand * il.product_id::numeric) AS TotalInventoryValue FROM inventory_levels il JOIN warehouses wh ON il.warehouse_id = wh.warehouse_id GROUP BY wh.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List products that had stock transfers in the last 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.sku AS product_sku, p.name AS product_name FROM products p INNER JOIN transfer_lines tl ON p.product_id = tl.product_id INNER JOIN stock_transfers st ON tl.transfer_id = st.transfer_id WHERE st.transfer_date >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '30 days' LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total spend by vendor this year?
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_name, SUM(vi.amount) AS total_spend FROM vendor_invoices vi JOIN vendors v ON vi.vendor_id = v.vendor_id WHERE YEAR(fiscal_years.start_date) = fiscal_years.year GROUP BY v.vendor_name LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column v.vendor_name does not exist

results.question: List purchase orders that are overdue (expected date passed but not received)
results.sql_generated: SELECT s.* FROM sales_orders s JOIN goods_receipts g ON g.po_id = s.order_id WHERE s.ship_date IS NULL AND s.required_date < CURRENT_DATE LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show the approval rate for purchase requisitions
results.sql_generated: SELECT ROUND((SUM(CASE WHEN status = 'Approved' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*)) * 100, 2) AS approval_rate FROM purchase_requisitions LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total debit and credit for each account in the current period?
results.sql_generated: SELECT b.account_number AS account_number, SUM(b.amount) AS total_debit, SUM(t.amount) AS total_credit FROM bank_transactions t JOIN bank_accounts b ON t.bank_account_id = b.bank_account_id WHERE t.transaction_date BETWEEN CURRENT_DATE AND (SELECT MAX(fiscal_periods.end_date) FROM fiscal_periods) GROUP BY b.account_number LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column b.amount does not exist

results.question: List all posted journal entries for the current month
results.sql_generated: SELECT j.entry_id, j.entry_number, j.entry_date, j.description, j.status FROM journal_entries AS j WHERE EXTRACT(MONTH FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(MONTH FROM CURRENT_DATE) AND EXTRACT(YEAR FROM j.entry_date) = EXTRACT(YEAR FROM CURRENT_DATE);
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Show budget vs actual spending by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(b.total_amount) - SUM(p.actual_amount) AS variance FROM budgets b INNER JOIN departments d ON b.department_id = d.department_id LEFT JOIN project_budgets p ON b.budget_id = p.budget_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: What is the total expense amount per project?
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.project_id, SUM(pe.amount) AS total_expenses FROM projects p JOIN project_expenses pe ON p.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List projects that are over budget
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.* FROM projects AS p JOIN budgets AS b ON p.project_id = b.budget_id WHERE p.actual_end_date IS NOT NULL AND (p.planned_end_date - p.start_date) < 0 GROUP BY p.project_id, p.name HAVING SUM(b.total_amount) > p.budget LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Show project resources and their allocation percentages
results.sql_generated: SELECT r.project_id, p.name AS project_name, r.role, r.allocation_percent FROM project_resources r JOIN projects p ON r.project_id = p.project_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List fixed assets by category with their total purchase cost
results.sql_generated: SELECT f.category_id, SUM(f.purchase_cost) AS total_purchase_cost FROM fixed_assets f JOIN asset_categories ac ON f.category_id = ac.category_id GROUP BY f.category_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List assets due for maintenance in the next 30 days
results.sql_generated: SELECT a.asset_id, a.name AS AssetName, am.maintenance_type_id, am.scheduled_date, at.from_location_id, at.to_location_id, dt.created_at FROM fixed_assets a INNER JOIN asset_maintenance am ON a.asset_id = am.asset_id INNER JOIN asset_transfers at ON a.asset_id = at.asset_id INNER JOIN depreciation_schedules ds ON a.asset_id = ds.asset_id INNER JOIN maintenance_types mt ON am.maintenance_type_id = mt.type_id WHERE am.completed_date IS NULL OR am.completed_date > CURRENT_DATE + INTERVAL '30 days' ORDER BY a.created_at DESC LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: missing FROM-clause entry for table "dt"

results.question: How many documents are attached to each entity type?
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.entity_type, COUNT(d.attachment_id) AS num_documents FROM document_attachments d GROUP BY d.entity_type LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate employee turnover rate by department for 2024
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, (CAST(COUNT(CASE WHEN e.termination_date BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-12-31' THEN 1 END) AS FLOAT) / COUNT(*)) * 100 AS turnover_rate FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department_id GROUP BY department_name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Find the salary percentile ranking for each employee within their department
results.sql_generated:
SELECT e.employee_id, CONCAT(e.first_name, ' ', e.last_name) AS full_name, p.title, s.amount, (s.amount / d.budget) * 100 AS salary_percentile FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department_id = d.department
                    department_id LEFT JOIN positions p ON e.position_id = p.position_id LEFT JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id AND (s.effective_date <= CURRENT_DATE OR s.end_date IS NULL) WHERE d.department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM employees GROUP BY department_id) LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: syntax error at or near "department_id"

results.question: Identify employees who have not completed mandatory training
results.sql_generated: SELECT e.* FROM employees e LEFT JOIN employee_training et ON e.employee_id = et.employee_id AND et.status = 'completed' WHERE et.employee_id IS NULL AND et.course_id IN (SELECT course_id FROM training_courses WHERE is_mandatory = TRUE) LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate month-over-month sales growth rate for the past 12 months
Find the average order value and order frequency for each customer segment based on credit limit
results.sql_generated: SELECT c.segment, AVG(s.total) AS avg_order_value, COUNT(*) / 30 AS order_frequency FROM customers c JOIN sales_orders s ON c.customer_id = s.customer_id GROUP BY c.segment LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column c.segment does not exist

results.question: What is the sales pipeline weighted value by stage and expected close month?
results.sql_generated: SELECT opportunity_stages.name AS stage, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM actual_close_date) AS month, SUM((sales_opportunities.amount * opportunity_stages.probability / 100) + (purchase_orders.subtotal * sales_opportunities.probability / 100)) AS weighted_value FROM sales_opportunities INNER JOIN opportunity_stages ON sales_opportunities.stage_id = opportunity_stages.id LEFT JOIN purchase_orders ON sales_opportunities.po_id = purchase_orders.id LEFT JOIN vendor_invoice_lines ON purchase_orders.po_line_id = vendor_invoice_lines.po_line_id INNER JOIN sales_quotes ON sales_opportunities.quote_id = sales_quotes.id WHERE opportunity_stages.is_closed =;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate inventory turnover ratio by product category
results.sql_generated: SELECT pc.name AS product_category, SUM(ilv.quantity_available) / AVG(p.unit_cost) AS avg_inventory_turnover_ratio FROM inventory_levels ilv JOIN products p ON ilv.product_id = p.product_id JOIN product_categories pc ON p.category_id = pc.category_id GROUP BY pc.name LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Identify products with significant inventory discrepancies (adjustment > 10% of stock)
results.sql_generated: SELECT p.product_id, p.name, i.quantity_on_hand, i.quantity_available, a.quantity_change FROM products AS p INNER JOIN inventory_levels AS i ON p.product_id = i.product_id INNER JOIN adjustment_lines AS a ON p.product_id = a.product_id WHERE a.quantity_change > (i.quantity_on_hand + 0.1 * i.quantity_available) LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Calculate vendor performance score based on on-time delivery and invoice accuracy
results.sql_generated: SELECT v.vendor_id, AVG(CASE WHEN iv.due_date >= iv.invoice_date THEN 100 ELSE 50 END + CASE WHEN iv.amount_paid = iv.total THEN 25 ELSE 0 END) AS vendor_performance_score FROM vendors v JOIN purchase_orders po ON v.vendor_id = po.vendor_id JOIN vendor_invoices iv ON po.po_id = iv.po_id GROUP BY v.vendor_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Generate a trial balance for the current period showing debits and credits by account category
results.sql_generated: SELECT ac.category AS category, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'debit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_debits, SUM(CASE WHEN bt.transaction_type = 'credit' THEN bt.amount ELSE 0 END) AS total_credits FROM bank_accounts ba INNER JOIN asset_categories ac ON ba.gl_account_id = ac.asset_id LEFT JOIN bank_transactions bt ON ba.bank_account_id = bt.bank_account_id GROUP BY ac.category LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column ac.asset_id does not exist

results.question: Calculate cash flow from bank transactions grouped by transaction type and month
results.sql_generated:
SELECT transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date) AS month, SUM(amount * (1 - is_reconciled)) OVER (PARTITION BY transaction_type, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM transaction_date)) as cash_flow 
FROM bank_transactions 
JOIN bank_accounts ON bank_transactions.bank_account_id = bank_accounts.bank_account_id 
GROUP BY transaction_type, month;
results.error_message: Failed to generate valid SQL after 3 attempts

results.question: Calculate project profitability comparing budget vs actual expenses
results.sql_generated: SELECT pb.project_id, SUM(pb.planned_amount) AS planned_total, SUM(pe.actual_amount) AS actual_total, (SUM(pb.planned_amount) - SUM(pe.actual_amount)) AS profitability FROM project_budgets pb INNER JOIN project_expenses pe ON pb.project_id = pe.project_id GROUP BY pb.project_id LIMIT 1000;
results.error_message: Database error after 3 attempts: column pe.actual_amount does not exist

results.question: Find resource allocation by employee across all active projects
results.sql_generated: SELECT pr.project_id, pe.employee_id, SUM(pr.allocation_percent * 240) AS total_hours_allocated FROM project_resources AS pr JOIN employees AS pe ON pr.employee_id = pe.employee_id WHERE pe.is_active AND EXISTS (SELECT p.project_id FROM projects AS p WHERE p.status = 'Active' AND p.project_id = pr.project_id) GROUP BY pr.project_id, pe.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: List all fixed assets with their assigned employees and current locations
results.sql_generated: SELECT fa.asset_id AS asset_id, fa.name AS name, fa.location_id AS location_id, e.employee_id AS employee_id, e.first_name AS first_name, e.last_name AS last_name FROM fixed_assets fa JOIN employees e ON fa.assigned_to = e.employee_id LIMIT 1000;

results.question: Create a comprehensive employee cost report including salary and benefits by department
results.sql_generated: SELECT d.name AS department_name, SUM(s.amount) + AVG(e.salary) AS total_cost FROM departments d LEFT JOIN employees e ON d.department_id = e.employee_id INNER JOIN employee_salaries s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id INNER JOIN employee_benefits b ON e.employee_id = b.employee_id GROUP BY d.name LIMIT 1000;
